DESCRIPTION
Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â»---------------------------------------------------------------Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â«

Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â» 'Fanny and Alexander' is the story of two children belonging to a wealthy, extensive theatrical family in provincial Sweden in the early years of the 20th century, 10-year-old Alexander (Bertil Guve) and his younger sister, Fanny (Pernilla Alwin). When their father dies unexpectedly during a performance and their mother decides to remarry, the children are forced to relocate to the austere (and possibly haunted) home of their stern and rather coldhearted stepfather, Bishop Vergerus (Jan Malmsjo). A means of escape is eventually provided by Isak Jacobi (Erland Josephson), a longtime friend of the Ekdahl family's who seems to possess magical powers. 

In this somewhat autobiographical movie, which was filmed in the directorÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s hometown of Uppsala, the gifted, precocious Alexander is a stand-in for Bergman himself, who had a problematic relationship with his own father, a strict clergyman.
